title: Font used by the humor magazine 'Die Muskete'
content:
Hi everyone,

Can anybody help me to find this font ?  
It's used in the humor magazine Die Muskete (between 1914 and 1917).

Thanks in advance !

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417im_/http:/typophile.com/files/15196338678_30037e7846_o_4060.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [15196338678\_30037e7846\_o.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/typophile.com/files/15196338678_30037e7846_o.jpg) | 360.86 KB |
author: Alphonse

comments.content: E is slightly different in each case - hand lettered - art not font.

Art Nouveau and hand-lettered as already said by Bob. Reminds me of loosely [Hobo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/hobo).  
Alternatives: [Brillant](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/brillant), [Herold](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/herold), [Marshall](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/marshall), [Roberta](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/roberta), [Edelgotish](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hihretrofonts/edelgotisch)

Ryuk, thanks for the well chosen collection of digital fonts with various similarities to the letters. Another: Metropolitaines [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/metropolitaines/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/metropolitaines/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/metropolitaines/")  
I wonder if the title lettering artist ever produced anymore lettering in this style?  
Otto Eckmann?  
Note the caption which is similar to his eponymous font

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417im_/http:/typophile.com/files/EckmannInUseAsNunmuss_4522.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eckmann/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141005160417/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eckmann/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eckmann/")  
Don
